Judul: HEAP LEACH STABILITY ANALYSIS USING PFC2D
Abstrak:
Leaching is one of the methods used to process gold ore from mining. In the whole mining and processing process,
leaching is one of the processes that can cause the material to experience a reduction in grain size. To determine
ihe effect of grain size reduction on heap leach stability, an analysis was performed using the PFC2D program.
This program can model the heap leach material as particles that have contact forces with each other. The model
that will be made is heap leach with input parameters in the form of microparameters and grain size distribution
that is adjusted to the grain size of the material in the field. The output obtained from PFC2D can be in the form
of the principal stress received by the material on the heap leach. The principal stress obtained will be plotted on
the Mohr Coulomb curve. From these plots, it is found that the principal stress of the heap leach material is close

to the strength envelope, which means that the heap leach is in the critical region or near to instability.
Kontributor / Dosen Pembimbing: Tri Karian, Simon Heru Prassetyo, and Budi Sulistianto
